greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the coefficient of x^k in the monic characteristic polynomial of the n X n matrix with 2's on the diagonal and 1's elsewhere (n >= 1 and  0 <= k <= n). Row 0 consists of the single term 1.
example: The monic characteristic polynomial of the matrix [2 1 1 / 1 2 1 / 1 1 2] is x^3 - 6*x^2 + 9*x - 4; so T(3,0) = -4, T(3,1) = 9, T(3,2) = -6, T(3,3) = 1.
Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k >= 0) begins as follows:
maple: with(linalg): a:=proc(i,j) if i=j then 2 else 1 fi end: 1;for n from 1 to 11 do seq(coeff(expand(x*charpoly(matrix(n,n,a),x)),x^k),k=1..n+1) od; # yields the sequence in triangular form
xref: Row sums yield the sequence 1, -1, 0, 0, 0, ... . Row sums of the unsigned triangle yield A001792. See A093375 for a signed version. A103406 is a mirror image.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Feb 04 2005
